content: The Act titled "Veterans Traumatic Brain Injury Treatment Act of 2007" introduces screening, rehabilitation, and treatment for traumatic brain injury under a new subchapter in Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code. The Act "Veterans Traumatic Brain Injury Treatment Act of 2007" establishes a screening program for eligible veterans to screen for symptoms of traumatic brain injury. The Secretary is required to submit an annual report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs regarding the number of veterans screened under the program. The Act establishes a screening program for veterans to screen for traumatic brain injury symptoms. The Secretary must submit an annual report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs with information on the number of veterans screened, prevalence of symptoms, and recommendations for improving care.
